pullRequest.body:
This will allow generalising results from normed spaces/normed groups to `ENNReal` also.
From the Carleson project.
A future PR will generalise lemmas in mathlib to use these new classes.

---

- [x] depends on: #21449 for fixing the simpNF linter time-out

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ContinuousENorm`
`+ ENormedAddCommMonoid`
`+ ENormedAddMonoid`
`+ ENormedCommMonoid`
`+ ENormedMonoid`
`+ instance [SeminormedAddGroup E] : ContinuousENorm E`
`+ instance [SeminormedGroup E] : ContinuousENorm E`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

The diagnostics output on the simp lemma is not helpful: putting 
```lean
set_option diagnostics true in
example (I : Ideal (MvPolynomial œÉ k)) : vanishingIdeal (zeroLocus I) = sorry := by simp
```
at the end of `Mathlib/RingTheory/Nullstellensatz.lean` (i.e., the LHS of the lemma that times out in CI) yields

```
[diag] Diagnostics ‚ñº
  [reduction] unfolded declarations (max: 156, num: 8): ‚ñ∂
  [reduction] unfolded instances (max: 975, num: 38): ‚ñº
    [] Field.toCommRing ‚Ü¶ 975     [] CommRing.toRing ‚Ü¶ 912     [] Ring.toSemiring ‚Ü¶ 717     [] CommSemiring.toSemiring ‚Ü¶ 657     [] EuclideanDomain.toCommRing ‚Ü¶ 550     [] Field.toEuclideanDomain ‚Ü¶ 550     [] Semiring.toNonUnitalSemiring ‚Ü¶ 484     [] NonUnitalSemiring.toNonUnitalNonAssocSemiring ‚Ü¶ 444     [] Semiring.toNonAssocSemiring ‚Ü¶ 404     [] NonAssocSemiring.toNonUnitalNonAssocSemiring ‚Ü¶ 400     [] NonUnitalNonAssocSemiring.toAddCommMonoid ‚Ü¶ 366     [] CommRing.toCommSemiring ‚Ü¶ 349     [] Field.toSemifield ‚Ü¶ 342     [] Semifield.toCommSemiring ‚Ü¶ 342     [] AddCommMonoid.toAddMonoid ‚Ü¶ 318     [] DivisionRing.toRing ‚Ü¶ 269     [] AddMonoid.toAddZeroClass ‚Ü¶ 88     [] AddZeroClass.toZero ‚Ü¶ 84     [] MulZeroClass.toZero ‚Ü¶ 84     [] NonUnitalNonAssocSemiring.toMulZeroClass ‚Ü¶ 84     [] PartialOrder.toPreorder ‚Ü¶ 84     [] LinearOrder.toPartialOrder ‚Ü¶ 80     [] Preorder.toLT ‚Ü¶ 48     [] Finset.instUnion ‚Ü¶ 40     [] AddMonoid.toAddSemigroup ‚Ü¶ 36     [] AddMonoidAlgebra.commRing ‚Ü¶ 35     [] instCommRingMvPolynomial ‚Ü¶ 35     [] AddMonoidAlgebra.nonUnitalNonAssocSemiring ‚Ü¶ 34     [] AddMonoidAlgebra.nonUnitalSemiring ‚Ü¶ 34     [] AddMonoidAlgebra.nonUnitalCommSemiring ‚Ü¶ 30     [] Lattice.toSemilatticeSup ‚Ü¶ 30     [] NonUnitalCommSemiring.toNonUnitalSemiring ‚Ü¶ 30     [] SemilatticeSup.toPartialOrder ‚Ü¶ 30     [] Finsupp.instAddCommMonoid ‚Ü¶ 28     [] Finsupp.instAddMonoid ‚Ü¶ 28     [] AddCommGroup.toAddGroup ‚Ü¶ 22     [] AddGroup.toSubNegMonoid ‚Ü¶ 22     [] SubNegMonoid.toAddMonoid ‚Ü¶ 22 
  [reduction] unfolded reducible declarations (max: 96, num: 11): ‚ñ∂
  [def_eq] heuristic for solving `f a =?= f b` (max: 60, num: 1): ‚ñ∂
```

The instance searches do not traverse anything related to ENorm. (In fact, reverting the ENorm change does not change anything in the output.)
Yes, please also add the multiplicative versions of these classes, so that we can keep using `to_additive`
Added (and force-pushed, sorry).

Can you add a doc of the form "We don't have `ENormedAddCommGroup` extend `EMetricSpace`, since the canonical instance `‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû` is not an `EMetricSpace`. The reason that `‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû` isn't an `EMetricSpace` is because it carries the order-topology, which is distinct from the topology coming from `edist`."

Upon reflection, the definition of `EMetricSpace` might just be "wrong" in that it is undesirable to require that the topology comes from `edist`. You rarely want to think of points with distance `‚àû` from every other point to be isolated points.

And indeed: the only instances for `EMetricSpace` come from other `EMetricSpace`s or from `MetricSpace`.

But changing that is of course not part of this PR, so the previous description is still useful to have.
Other than that, LGTM, but I'll let someone else merge/delegate it, since I'm a coauthor.

Added a comment.

The simpNF linter still fails, and I'm still at a loss why.
@JovanGerb diagnosed the hang and found a fix :tada: I hope that with it included, the linting step will finally pass.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21449~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
@fpvandoorn I copied the instances from your Carleson file; this causes issues (including what looks like a diamond to me); you can see the build failing. I haven't looked into it deeply so far.

One step further: now line 993 errors. The relevant snippet is (line 993 is the to_additive).
```
@[to_additive Filter.Tendsto.enorm]
lemma Filter.Tendsto.enorm' (h : Tendsto f l (ùìù a)) : Tendsto (‚Äñf ¬∑‚Äñ‚Çë) l (ùìù ‚Äña‚Äñ‚Çë) :=
  .comp continuous_enorm'.continuousAt h
```

The error message is
```
application type mismatch
  instContinuousENorm
argument has type
  SeminormedAddGroup E
but function has type
  [inst : SeminormedGroup E] ‚Üí ContinuousENorm E
```

I wonder: `continuous_enorm(')` on line 950 takes no argument `E`, but `ENormed(Add)Monoid` does. Is this related to this error?
Closing in favour of #21670 (which passes CI now).
I presume `continuous_nnnorm'` (with prime) errors with this? The reason is that you didn't define a multiplicative version of this instance.
The unprimed version errors - but using `continuous_nnnorm'` fixes it (both in the additive and multiplicative version).
(There are further errors further below, see the main comment.)
Another fun fact: `continuous_enorm` does *not* work here - while `continuous_enorm'` works three lines above.
That seems like a serious issue. Did you investigate?

To the extent of "this seems wrong, but I don't really know why/how to narrow this down", yes. Put differently: I'm asking you to better understand what's going on here, and your last answers are certainly progress.
I don't understand yet why this is. I'll tell you if the most recent fix helps (after bumping carleson).
The error here is that you have both `SeminormedGroup E` (as a section variable) and `SeminormedAddGroup E`, so you have two different norms.
:bulb: Yes, of course! With the other changes, this also got fixed.
Can you `@[to_additive]` this? Not having that will cause failures.
This almost certainly causes the error you posted

I had tried that before. If I do
```
@[to_additive]
instance [SeminormedGroup E] : ContinuousENorm E where
  continuous_enorm := ENNReal.continuous_coe.comp continuous_nnnorm'
```
I get an error `to_additive: can't transport instContinuousENorm to itself`.

The main doc-string of to_additive doesn't mention that error. What's the correct fix?
I (somewhat blindly) had tried putting `to_additive` on `ContinuousENorm`; that also errors.

> I get an error to_additive: can't transport instContinuousENorm to itself.

The error message should be improved! It means that the additivised name is the same as the multiplicative name. The correct fix here is to correctly name the instance, namely `SeminormedGroup.toContinuousENorm`
Thanks for explaining. Naming the instance in a better way works.
Created #21716 for a better error message.

This import increase is in tension with the aim to reduce the imports of this file, see https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/Turn.20.60Complex.2Eabs.60.20into.20.60Norm.60
cc @YaelDillies 

I guess you need this to know that one of the coercions is continuous?
I am interested to know why you need this new import, yes

```suggestion
@[to_additive]
instance SeminormedGroup.toContinuousENorm [SeminormedGroup E] : ContinuousENorm E where
  continuous_enorm := continuous_enorm'
```
tested locally
Of course, the lemma `continuous_enorm'` should be removed, and there should be a single `continuous_enorm` lemma that assumes the `ContinuousENorm` class.
Indeed! Changed, hopefully.

pullRequest.title: feat: add classes `ContinuousENorm` and `ENormed(Add)(Comm)Monoid`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

The diagnostics output on the simp lemma is not helpful: putting 
```lean
set_option diagnostics true in
example (I : Ideal (MvPolynomial œÉ k)) : vanishingIdeal (zeroLocus I) = sorry := by simp
```
at the end of `Mathlib/RingTheory/Nullstellensatz.lean` (i.e., the LHS of the lemma that times out in CI) yields

```
[diag] Diagnostics ‚ñº
  [reduction] unfolded declarations (max: 156, num: 8): ‚ñ∂
  [reduction] unfolded instances (max: 975, num: 38): ‚ñº
    [] Field.toCommRing ‚Ü¶ 975     [] CommRing.toRing ‚Ü¶ 912     [] Ring.toSemiring ‚Ü¶ 717     [] CommSemiring.toSemiring ‚Ü¶ 657     [] EuclideanDomain.toCommRing ‚Ü¶ 550     [] Field.toEuclideanDomain ‚Ü¶ 550     [] Semiring.toNonUnitalSemiring ‚Ü¶ 484     [] NonUnitalSemiring.toNonUnitalNonAssocSemiring ‚Ü¶ 444     [] Semiring.toNonAssocSemiring ‚Ü¶ 404     [] NonAssocSemiring.toNonUnitalNonAssocSemiring ‚Ü¶ 400     [] NonUnitalNonAssocSemiring.toAddCommMonoid ‚Ü¶ 366     [] CommRing.toCommSemiring ‚Ü¶ 349     [] Field.toSemifield ‚Ü¶ 342     [] Semifield.toCommSemiring ‚Ü¶ 342     [] AddCommMonoid.toAddMonoid ‚Ü¶ 318     [] DivisionRing.toRing ‚Ü¶ 269     [] AddMonoid.toAddZeroClass ‚Ü¶ 88     [] AddZeroClass.toZero ‚Ü¶ 84     [] MulZeroClass.toZero ‚Ü¶ 84     [] NonUnitalNonAssocSemiring.toMulZeroClass ‚Ü¶ 84     [] PartialOrder.toPreorder ‚Ü¶ 84     [] LinearOrder.toPartialOrder ‚Ü¶ 80     [] Preorder.toLT ‚Ü¶ 48     [] Finset.instUnion ‚Ü¶ 40     [] AddMonoid.toAddSemigroup ‚Ü¶ 36     [] AddMonoidAlgebra.commRing ‚Ü¶ 35     [] instCommRingMvPolynomial ‚Ü¶ 35     [] AddMonoidAlgebra.nonUnitalNonAssocSemiring ‚Ü¶ 34     [] AddMonoidAlgebra.nonUnitalSemiring ‚Ü¶ 34     [] AddMonoidAlgebra.nonUnitalCommSemiring ‚Ü¶ 30     [] Lattice.toSemilatticeSup ‚Ü¶ 30     [] NonUnitalCommSemiring.toNonUnitalSemiring ‚Ü¶ 30     [] SemilatticeSup.toPartialOrder ‚Ü¶ 30     [] Finsupp.instAddCommMonoid ‚Ü¶ 28     [] Finsupp.instAddMonoid ‚Ü¶ 28     [] AddCommGroup.toAddGroup ‚Ü¶ 22     [] AddGroup.toSubNegMonoid ‚Ü¶ 22     [] SubNegMonoid.toAddMonoid ‚Ü¶ 22 
  [reduction] unfolded reducible declarations (max: 96, num: 11): ‚ñ∂
  [def_eq] heuristic for solving `f a =?= f b` (max: 60, num: 1): ‚ñ∂
```

The instance searches do not traverse anything related to ENorm. (In fact, reverting the ENorm change does not change anything in the output.)
Yes, please also add the multiplicative versions of these classes, so that we can keep using `to_additive`
Added (and force-pushed, sorry).

Can you add a doc of the form "We don't have `ENormedAddCommGroup` extend `EMetricSpace`, since the canonical instance `‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû` is not an `EMetricSpace`. The reason that `‚Ñù‚â•0‚àû` isn't an `EMetricSpace` is because it carries the order-topology, which is distinct from the topology coming from `edist`."

Upon reflection, the definition of `EMetricSpace` might just be "wrong" in that it is undesirable to require that the topology comes from `edist`. You rarely want to think of points with distance `‚àû` from every other point to be isolated points.

And indeed: the only instances for `EMetricSpace` come from other `EMetricSpace`s or from `MetricSpace`.

But changing that is of course not part of this PR, so the previous description is still useful to have.
Other than that, LGTM, but I'll let someone else merge/delegate it, since I'm a coauthor.

Added a comment.

The simpNF linter still fails, and I'm still at a loss why.
@JovanGerb diagnosed the hang and found a fix :tada: I hope that with it included, the linting step will finally pass.

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - perf(RingTheory/Artinian): reorder arguments in `IsArtinianRing.isMaximal_of_isPrime`

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21449~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
@fpvandoorn I copied the instances from your Carleson file; this causes issues (including what looks like a diamond to me); you can see the build failing. I haven't looked into it deeply so far.

One step further: now line 993 errors. The relevant snippet is (line 993 is the to_additive).
```
@[to_additive Filter.Tendsto.enorm]
lemma Filter.Tendsto.enorm' (h : Tendsto f l (ùìù a)) : Tendsto (‚Äñf ¬∑‚Äñ‚Çë) l (ùìù ‚Äña‚Äñ‚Çë) :=
  .comp continuous_enorm'.continuousAt h
```

The error message is
```
application type mismatch
  instContinuousENorm
argument has type
  SeminormedAddGroup E
but function has type
  [inst : SeminormedGroup E] ‚Üí ContinuousENorm E
```

I wonder: `continuous_enorm(')` on line 950 takes no argument `E`, but `ENormed(Add)Monoid` does. Is this related to this error?
Closing in favour of #21670 (which passes CI now).

source.title: doc(Tactic/ToAdditive/Frontend): more helpful error message when a name cannot be tr‚Ä¶
